overview.title: Overview
overview.content:
Link Status Checker is a free online tool that allows you to check the status (HTTP status code) of all links contained in a web page at once.
 It quickly identifies broken links (404) and unnecessary redirects (301, 302) that can hinder SEO and user experience, helping to improve your site's reliability and ranking. This simple and practical tool completes analysis instantly with just a URL input.

steps.title: Enter the URL of the page you want to check
steps.description: Copy and paste the URL of the page whose link status you want to confirm into the form.

steps.title: Click 'Start Check'
steps.description: The tool automatically extracts links from the page and checks the status code for each linked destination.

steps.title: Review the link status
steps.description: Status codes (200, 404, 301, etc.) and URLs for each link are displayed in a list.

items.title: Bulk status check of all links on a page
items.description: Check HTTP status codes (200, 301, 404, etc.) of link destinations in bulk. From broken links to unnecessary redirects and external link monitoring, everything is completed in one operation.

items.title: Direct improvement of SEO and user experience
items.description: Broken links and redirects can affect Google's evaluation and cause user drop-offs. Early detection and fixing leads to improved search rankings, reliability, and navigation rates.

items.title: List display and export capabilities (optional)
items.description: Status results for each URL are displayed in list format, with optional functionality to download as CSV and other formats. Ideal for large sites and team operations.

items.title: Free, no registration, simple UI ready to use
items.description: No login required, one-click analysis possible just by pasting a URL. Easy to use even for non-engineers in your company, and ideal for regular link checking.

questions.question: Is there an upper limit to the number of links that can be checked?
questions.answer: Currently, we support up to 100 links per page. We plan to expand this in the future.

questions.question: I don't understand what the status codes mean?
questions.answer: They are displayed with simple explanations in the list, such as "200 = Normal", "301 = Permanent redirect", "302 = Temporary redirect", "404 = Page does not exist", etc.

questions.question: Can external links be checked too?
questions.answer: Yes, all external links included in the page (including external domains) are also checked.

questions.question: Can I check an entire site at once?
questions.answer: Currently, checking is done page by page, but we plan to add a feature for consecutive checking of multiple pages in the future.

questions.question: Are the URLs I enter and the results saved?
questions.answer: No, everything is processed in real-time and is not saved on the server. We are mindful of security and privacy.
